content: Say that [[layouts]] is a constant (so always the same).

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Thank you for your time and energy. I found this to take too long and a bit too complex. Take care.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun and intuitive clash :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: L'énoncé est clair et on comprend rapidement ce qu'on doit faire

Goal
* When you write "ink pad" do you actually mean a "letter stamp"? Refer to the Wikipedia entry for clarification: https://simple.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inkpad

* Please change "each segment" to "each full segment".

* Please mention that the space character does not require any ink.

* Please delete the last sentence, as the final cost should never need rounding; the rounding should already be handled when calculating the number of ink flasks to buy.

Input
* Line 4: Please add "lowercase" before "letters".

* Line 4: Please change [[7_segment_layouts]] to [[layouts]].

Input / Output / Constraints
* Please change "price" to "cost" everywhere.

Output
* Please add ", shown to 2 decimal places" at the end.

Constraints
* All cases currently violate the second constraint. Please fix this.

* Please add:
[[text]] contains lowercase English letters and spaces only.

Stub generator
* Line 2: Please change "P" to "inkPadCost" (or most probably "letterStampCost").

* Line 3: Please change "F" to "inkFlaskCost".

* Line 4: Please change to loopline 26 layout:word(7).

Game modes
* Reverse mode might be too difficult for players to guess the requirement. Please consider disabling it.

Cases
* Please revise your code and change all the case outputs to show 2 decimal places.

* Please add a new pair of cases where all 26 letters are present in [[text]]. Use real words and ensure that some letters appear more than once.

Thanks.

Thanks a lot for all these very useful insights !
I've integrated them all, if you'd like to see.

Looking good! The [[text]] in the two new cases are perfect for the purpose.

Just one more adjustment:

Input/Constraints
* Please update the variable names, replacing "Price" with "Cost" everywhere.

Thanks.
